taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs at midwater to bottom depths of medium-sized streams in forests.  Not known to migrate, but may move upstream during periods of high water levels.  Does not persist in impoundments.  Most likely sold fresh (Ref. 12693).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  Maeklong, Mekong and Chao Phraya basins; Malay Peninsula.
dataObjects.references: Kottelat, M. 2001 Fishes of Laos. WHT Publications Ltd., Colombo 5, Sri Lanka. 198 p. (Ref. 43281)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Rainboth, W.J. 1996 Fishes of the Cambodian Mekong. FAO Species Identification Field Guide for Fishery Purposes. FAO, Rome, 265 p. (Ref. 12693)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Upper body reddish brown; pelvic and anal fins red to reddish orange; 1 scale count between the vent and anal fin (Ref. 37768).  Robust body, not compressed; 3-5 gill rakers on lower arm of first arch; 7-9 predorsal scales; and 9-14 dorsal-spine serrations (Ref. 12693).  Usually with 2 scale rows between anus and anal origin; distance between distal serrae on posterior margin of last simple dorsal ray much greater than width on bases of serrae (Ref. 43281).

Type for Puntius wetmorei
Catalog Number: USNM 90295

agents.full_name: National Museum of Natural History Collections

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: benthopelagic; potamodromous (Ref. 51243); freshwater; pH range: 7.0; dH range: 15
dataObjects.references: Riede, K. 2004 Global register of migratory species - from global to regional scales. Final Report of the R&D-Projekt 808 05 081. Federal Agency for Nature Conservation, Bonn, Germany. 329 p. (Ref. 51243)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Migration
dataObjects.description: Potamodromous. Migrating within streams, migratory in rivers, e.g. Saliminus, Moxostoma, Labeo.  Migrations should be cyclical and predictable and cover more than 100 km.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Uses
dataObjects.title: Importance
dataObjects.description: fisheries: minor commercial; aquaculture: commercial; aquarium: commercial
